definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
(TCM) sudden strong emotions attacking the heart, leading to faints etc/(fig.) to fly into a fit of anger

sentences.english: The child glanced at his angry father timidly.
sentences.chinese: 孩子怯生生地瞟了一眼怒气冲冲的父亲。

sentences.english: Angered even further, Kojiro leapt into combat, blinded by rage.
sentences.chinese: 因此，小次郎更加愤怒了，而被怒气遮蔽了双眼。

sentences.english: Mimi completely defused after listen to hypocrisy, turn to Lou issa says congratulations.
sentences.chinese: 咪咪听后怒气全消，转而假意向卢伊萨表示恭喜。

sentences.english: Never to master one's anger is a mark of intemperance and lack of training.
sentences.chinese: 不能克制怒气是任性和缺乏教养的标志。

sentences.english: He shot out some angry words.
sentences.chinese: 他迸出几句怒气冲冲的话。

sentences.english: Surrounding the Camaro, a group of pissed-off punks stared down at Jack.
sentences.chinese: 科迈罗车周围，一群小混混怒气冲冲地盯着杰克。

sentences.english: Lest the LORD see it, and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕耶和华看见就不喜悦，将怒气从仇敌身上转过来。

sentences.english: Studies show, however, that the notion of anger catharsis is poppycock .
sentences.chinese: 然而，研究表明，怒气情绪宣泄的念头根本没有意义。

sentences.english: The boss is still mad about losing the  contract.
sentences.chinese: 老板丢了合约怒气未消。

sentences.english: Scorners set a city aflame, But wise men turn away wrath.
sentences.chinese: 8亵慢人煽惑通城，智慧人却使怒气转消。

sentences.english: The manager stormed into my office,waving a piece of paper about.
sentences.chinese: 经理怒气冲冲闯进我的办公室，手里挥着一份文件。

sentences.english: He tried to soothe her anger.
This anger, I think, is atavistic.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得，这怒气是一种返祖现象。

sentences.english: He vented his anger on his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他在老婆身上发泄怒气。

sentences.english: QiLe know QiRen looking for Fanny after pretending to be a mother, angry.
sentences.chinese: 祁乐知道祁仁找芬妮假扮母亲后，怒气冲天。

sentences.english: Woe to the Assyrian, the rod of my anger, in whose hand is the club of my wrath!
sentences.chinese: 亚述是我怒气的棍，手中拿我恼恨的杖。

definition: to fly into a rage/to rage violently
